Snap - Rame

20 Apr 2008
I fixed my filters to allow me to display embedded youtube movies.
The chance that I will use this feature a lot is pretty slim, because I'm not fond of Flash at all (being an "open" protocol with licensing on it)

Debian can has new DD now!

18 Apr 2008
After more than 4 months, the task of creating accounts for new debian developers has been delegated to someone who has more time. He finished the task quickly, meaning that there are now _a lot_ more Debian Developers.

I'm glad to read that. The blogs on Planet Debian reflect the same relief from Debian people.

Secretaressedag!

17 Apr 2008
Vandaag, 17 april 2008 (3de donderdag van april) is het secretaressedag. Volgens wikipedia is het vandaag de bedoeling om "de secretaresse in het zonnetje te zetten, stil te staan bij zijn/haar toegevoegde waarde voor de organisatie en om het imago van het secretaressevak te verbeteren.

Normaliter iets dat managers moeten doen, maar ik ga vandaag toch ook effe mijn dank betuigen voor al hun werk :)

Aan de andere kant hoop ik ook dat er dit jaar op LUDIT een Sysadmindag gevierd wordt, dat is op de laatste vrijdag van juli, dit jaar op 25 juli 2008.

Gnome Planner

16 Apr 2008
In anticipation of my (almost) 2 month holiday coming up this summer, I have decided to take a look at Gnome Planner so I can make efficient use of my time and pack it full of cool projects.

[Man, what kind of a geek am I anyway ? I should spend summertime chasing girls and bathing in the sun. But hey, I guess I can plan for that with Gnome Planner]

I've used Gantt charts before and I'm pretty familiar with planning (although you wouldn't believe it), but I would really like to have some kind of tutorial for Gnome Planner so that I can make optimal use of all of its features. The main website doesn't offer much information and a quick search on google doesn't reveal any obvious information pools.

I have now just discovered that there is a "User Guide" built into Planner, which contains enough information to get me started.

If all this goes well, I hope to finish a LOT or projects this summer ;)

Is Debian dieing ?

15 Apr 2008
Planet Debian has a few posts on how silly administrative tasks and procedures are slowing down Debian development and discouraging new maintainers.

This is a very sad development and I hope it will be resolved soon. I have wanted to go through the NM process aswell so I could contribute to Debian, but the process looks so complicated and timeconsuming that I decided to delay it.
